Effect on the Conclusion of an Examination

) A primary objective of the Service is to resolve tax controversies at the level without sacrificing the quality and integrity of those determinations. native Dispute Resolution programs were developed to achieve this The objective of Early Referral is for Exam/Collection to work with Appeals to resolve cases more expeditiously. (
) Rev. Proc.

establishes the Early Referral (ER) Program to allow taxpayers under examination to request the transfer of a developed but unagreed issue to Appeals while the other issues in the case continue to be developed in Examination (Exam) or Collection. (

) Since the ER process is optional, the Service feels the taxpayer will fully cooperate and timely submit requested information. The taxpayer’s failure cooperate or respond to requests timely is reason to end the ER. (
) Appeals takes jurisdiction over issues accepted for ER. All other issues in case remain in Exam or Collection’s jurisdiction. (
) Either the taxpayer or Exam/Collection initiates ER to Appeals. When the taxpayer initiates the process, he/she must submit a written request to the Group Manager.
The taxpayer’s ER request must

a. identify the taxpayer and all related persons involved in the issues. b. state each tax period and issue covered by the ER request. c. describe the taxpayer’s position and provide a brief discussion of the material facts and an analysis of the facts and law as they apply to each ER issue.
The taxpayer’s written ER request must include the following declaration and be signed by either the taxpayer or the taxpayer’s authorized representative:
Appropriate issues for ER are limited to those that: (cid:
) if resolved, can reasonably be expected to result in a quicker resolution the entire case (cid:
) both the taxpayer and Exam or Collection agree should be referred to Appeals (cid:
) are fully developed (cid:
) are part of a case where the remaining issues are not expected to be completed before Appeals can resolve the ER issue(s).
part of a case where the remaining issues are not expected to be before Appeals can resolve the ER issue(s).

) ER of Collection issues is a different process than the Collection Due (CDP) procedures for liens and levies. (
) The ER procedures apply to a broader range of Collection issues than the CDP procedures. Appropriate Collection issues for ER include proposed: (cid:

) A taxpayer may not appeal the denial for ER; however, the taxpayer can ER Requests request a conference with the Group Manager who denied the request. (
) If the Group Manager does not approve the ER request with respect to any issue, the taxpayer retains the right to pursue the traditional appeal process that issue. (

days from the date the ER was accepted. (
) Once the taxpayer responds to “The Notification Form”, Exam or Collection sends the “ER Package” to Appeals.

The Exam or Collection Group Manager notifies the taxpayer of the decision to accept or reject an issue in the ER request within 14 days of receipt.
(3) If the Group Manager does not approve the ER request with respect to any issue, the taxpayer retains the right to pursue the traditional appeal process for

) The taxpayer must respond in writing to each proposed adjustment with an (
) explanation of their position regarding the issues. The response is Taxpayer Response to the Group Manager within
days (unless extended by the Group Proposed Adjustments from the date “The Notification Form” is sent to the taxpayer. (
) If a response is not received for any issue within the
days, the ER request is considered withdrawn.
) Appeals takes jurisdiction over the issues accepted for ER. All other issues (

) Upon receipt of an ER case, the ATM reviews the case for completeness (

) eligibility. If approved, the case is assigned and the “ER Package”, including Assignment of an Early the name of the Appeals Officer, is sent to Account and Processing Support Referral Issues (APS) for input into ACDS.

) When an agreement is reached in an ER issue, generally Form

) Agreement on Final Determination Covering Specific Matters, is prepared. Agreement Reached on closing agreement is used to compute the corrected tax as a partial Early Referral Issues prior to or concurrently with the resolution of any other issues in the case. (
) If an ER issue results in a refund or credit requiring a report to the Joint Committee on Taxation as described in IRC

, the report must include a copy of the proposed closing agreement signed by or for the taxpayer, but signed by or on behalf of the Commissioner. The Service signs the agreement after review by the Joint Committee.
) If ER negotiations are unsuccessful and an agreement is not reached: (

) a. Taxpayers may request mediation for the issue, provided the ER issue Agreement Not Reached meets the requirements for mediation. If mediation is not requested, on Early Referral Issues Appeals closes and returns the ER file, with a copy of the Appeals Memorandum (ACM) to Compliance. Jurisdiction is changed to Compli- ance. b. Appeals does not reconsider an unagreed ER issue if the entire case is later protested to Appeals, unless there has been a substantial change the circumstances regarding the issue.
Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) Program

The taxpayer’s written response to “The Notification Form” generally serves the same purpose as an Appeals protest so the established Appeals procedures in IRM 8.6.1, Conference and Settlement Practices apply.
When an agreement is reached in an ER issue, generally Form

, Agreement on Final Determination Covering Specific Matters, is prepared. closing agreement is used to compute the corrected tax as a partial prior to or concurrently with the resolution of any other issues in the case. If an ER issue results in a refund or credit requiring a report to the Joint Committee on Taxation as described in IRC

, the report must include a copy of the proposed closing agreement signed by or for the taxpayer, but signed by or on behalf of the Commissioner. The Service signs the agreement after review by the Joint Committee. If ER negotiations are unsuccessful and an agreement is not reached: a. Taxpayers may request mediation for the issue, provided the ER issue meets the requirements for mediation. If mediation is not requested, Appeals closes and returns the ER file, with a copy of the Appeals Memorandum (ACM) to Compliance. Jurisdiction is changed to Compli- ance. b. Appeals does not reconsider an unagreed ER issue if the entire case is later protested to Appeals, unless there has been a substantial change the circumstances regarding the issue.

) If a taxpayer withdraws an ER request after Appeals takes jurisdiction over issues, the withdrawal is treated the same as if no agreement was The withdrawal request must be communicated in writing to the Appeals Officer assigned the ER. (

ax = Revised dollars is computed the same way as the deficiency except use the amount determined by Appeals for an agreed case. For an unagreed case, enter the proposed deficiency. (
) When Exam or Collection completes the examination of any issues not referred as part of the ER process, a
-day letter is issued with respect to unagreed issues. The letter includes any issues referred under the ER that are still pending. (

) If the only unagreed issues in the case at the time the examination is concluded are issues that were considered by Appeals under the ER, a letter is not issued. Instead, a statutory notice of deficiency or
-day letter issued. (
) If Appeals takes jurisdiction of the remaining issues in the case after a letter is issued, all issues including the ER issues that are still open are sidered under established Appeals procedures.
